summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, regarding the immediate operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It details the need for agents to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: The author of the initial email requesting agent availability for the operational plan to arrest Epstein and conduct related investigative actions.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning for Arrest
events.description: The FBI squad begins planning to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FBI New York

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The plan also required deploying two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.
The email indicates the investigation was being handled by the FBI's New York office, specifically Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking.
